result.execSummary:
The defendant Alyssa R Nevis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Alyssa R Nevis is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Alyssa R Nevis was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Court costs due during probation term. Defendant to pay fine/costs on 15CM982 during probation period on this case. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

-AODA and any counseling/treatment deemed appropriate.
-Absolute sobriety.
-No controlled substances or prescription medication unless prescribed by physician and in conformity with said prescription.
-Submit DNA sample. 
-Pay supervision fees.
*If agent feels defendant's probation term should be shorter, they may petition the Court, however the Court is not inclinded to shorten probation term.
